Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.services Description

Service layer for ODP business logic and authorization.

Overview

This package contains the business logic layer for the ODP system. Services provide high-level operations for managing payment orders, enforcing business rules, validating user permissions, and orchestrating state transitions.

Core Components

IOdpService

IOdpService is the main service interface providing:

  • CRUD Operations - Create, read, update, delete ODPs with role validation
  • Search Operations - Search and count ODPs with filtering and pagination
  • Workflow Operations - Submit for approval, approve/reject ODPs
  • Reference Data - Retrieve companies, currencies, suppliers, etc.
  • Authorization - Retrieve authorization flows and validate passwords
  • User Management - Retrieve user information with roles

OdpService

OdpService is the default implementation of IOdpService that:

  • Delegates data access to IOdpRepository
  • Enforces role-based security on all operations
  • Validates business rules (state transitions, ownership, etc.)
  • Uses OdpUtils for permission checks

IOdpServiceFactory

IOdpServiceFactory provides factory methods for creating service instances:

  • createOdpService(String csvRepositoryPath) - Creates service with CSV repository
  • Extensible for adding other repository types (RDBMS, etc.)

Authorization and Security

Role-Based Permissions

All operations require a user ID and validate permissions based on the user's role:

  • PROPOSER:
    • Can create, update, delete ODPs (must be owner for update/delete)
    • Can submit own ODPs for approval
  • SIGNER_1:
    • Can approve/reject ODPs in WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1 state
  • SIGNER_2:
    • Can approve/reject ODPs in WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_2 state
  • PAYER:
    • Can approve/reject ODPs in WAITING_AUTH_PAYER state
    • Can execute payments for PAYABLE ODPs

State-Based Validation

Operations are validated against the current ODP state:

  • Edit operations allowed only in DRAFT or TEMPLATE states
  • Submit for approval allowed only in DRAFT state
  • Approval operations allowed only in WAITING_AUTH_* states

Ownership Validation

Certain operations require ownership:

  • Update/delete requires user to be the ODP owner
  • Submit for approval requires user to be the ODP owner

Password Authentication

Approval operations require password validation to ensure security.

Exception Handling

IllegalStateException

Thrown when an operation violates business rules or security constraints:

  • User lacks required role permissions
  • User is not the owner when ownership is required
  • ODP is in wrong state for the operation

IllegalArgumentException

Thrown for invalid input parameters:

  • Null or empty required fields
  • Backend-only fields provided in create/update operations
  • Entity not found (ODP, user, company, etc.)

Usage Examples

Creating a Service


 // Using factory
 IOdpService service = IOdpServiceFactory.createOdpService("/data/odp/csv");

CRUD Operations


 // Create (PROPOSER role required)
 Odp odp = new Odp();
 odp.setAzienda(company);
 odp.setValuta(currency);
 String odpId = service.createOdp(odp, "proposer123");

 // Read
 Odp retrieved = service.findOdpById(odpId);

 // Update (PROPOSER role, must be owner)
 retrieved.setImporto(2000.00);
 service.updateOdp(retrieved, "proposer123");

 // Delete (PROPOSER role, must be owner)
 service.deleteOdp(odpId, "proposer123");

Workflow Operations


 // Submit for approval (PROPOSER, must be owner)
 service.submitOdpForApproval(odpId, "proposer123");

 // Approve (SIGNER_1 role required)
 OdpAuthorizationStep step = new OdpAuthorizationStep();
 step.setUser(signerUser);
 step.setApproved(true);
 step.setNotes("Approved");
 boolean approved = service.approveOdp(odpId, "password123", step);

 if (!approved) {
     // Password validation failed
 }

Search Operations


 // Build search criteria
 OdpSearchCriteria criteria = new OdpSearchCriteria();
 criteria.setCompany(company);
 criteria.setOwnerUserId("proposer123");

 OdpSortCriteria sort = new OdpSortCriteria();
 sort.setColumn(OdpSearchResultColumnType.DATA_COMPILAZIONE);
 sort.setAscending(false);

 // Search with pagination
 List<Odp> results = service.searchOdps(criteria, sort, 0, 50);
 int totalCount = service.countOdps(criteria);
Version:
3.0
